decks.notes: This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on casting powerful Eldrazi creatures quickly and efficiently, using cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to ramp up mana. Cards like Devourer of Destiny and Writhing Chrysalis provide a strong aggro game plan, while Thought-Knot Seer disrupts the opponent's hand. Malevolent Rumble and Kozilek's Return offer board control options, and Emrakul, the Promised End creates a massive threat. The deck also includes lands that support the Eldrazi theme, such as Eldrazi Temple and Ugin's Labyrinth.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy while building your own board presence. By utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to control the opponent's creatures and spells, along with Aether Vial to quickly deploy your own threats, you can apply constant pressure and tempo advantage. By combining efficient removal and disruptive creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Flickerwisp, along with powerful finishers like Overlord of the Balemurk and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, you can overwhelm your opponent and secure victory through aggressive plays and resource denial.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and hand disruption. By controlling the board and the opponent's hand, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's strategy and gain card advantage over time. The deck also includes threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to control the game and win through incremental advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly and aggressively deal damage to the opponent using low-cost creatures and spells, while also utilizing card draw and selection to maintain a consistent flow of threats and answers. The deck focuses on maximizing efficiency and tempo, taking advantage of synergies between cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Lava Dart, as well as utilizing the prowess ability on creatures like Monastery Swiftspear. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of direct damage and efficient combat tricks, ultimately outpacing them to secure a swift victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Jeskai Ascendancy combo to generate infinite mana and draw their entire deck. It includes cards that allow for recursion and manipulation of artifacts, such as Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga. It also features control elements like Metallic Rebuke and Repeal to protect the combo and disrupt the opponent. The goal is to assemble the Jeskai Ascendancy combo quickly and efficiently, overwhelming the opponent with a powerful and unstoppable engine.

This deck revolves around casting multiple spells in a turn to create a powerful combo chain that can win the game quickly. It utilizes cards like Mishra's Bauble and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate card advantage and fuel its engine. Song of Creation enables explosive plays by allowing additional draws and plays each turn. Once set up, the deck aims to either cast Grapeshot for lethal damage or use Jace, Wielder of Mysteries to win the game by drawing from an empty library. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Engineered Explosives to control the board and protect the combo.
